meanings.definition: Having a greater tendency to flow or drip
meanings.sent1: The ice cream melted and became runnier in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The sauce became runnier as it simmered on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The leaky faucet made the sink runnier than a river!
meanings.sent4: Her tears were runnier than the rain pouring outside.
meanings.sent5: The paint was runnier than expected, creating a messy masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The smoothie was runnier than the milkshake.
meanings.sent2: The runnier consistency of the soup made it easier to pour.
meanings.sent3: His excuse was runnier than a melting popsicle on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The runnier lava flowed swiftly down the volcano's slopes.
meanings.sent5: The runnier mixture seeped into the cracks, filling them completely.

meanings.definition: Showing a higher level of fluidity
meanings.sent1: The runnier paint spread easily across the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The runnier batter made the pancakes thin and crispy.
meanings.sent3: The runnier traffic made the commute even longer than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her runnier voice flowed melodiously through the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The runnier stream meandered through the meadow, reflecting the sunlight.
